data.title: Official Website for the HBO Series
data.meta_description: The official website for Music Box on HBO, featuring interviews, schedule information, behind the scenes exclusives, and more.
data.text:
Available Now

Music Box

2 SEASONs | 7 EPISODEs | TV-MA

WATCH NOWMAX

In his own words, renowned singer and songwriter Jason Isbell takes us on an unexpected journey through his musical evolution and creative process as he goes into the studio to record his new album “Reunions” with his band The 400 Unit.

Music Box, a Ringer Films Production in association with Polygram Entertainment, is a collection of documentary films created by Bill Simmons exploring pivotal moments in the music world. The series includes Woodstock 99: Peace, Love, and Rage, Jagged, DMX: Don't Try to Understand, Listening to Kenny G, Mr. Saturday Night, Juice WRLD: Into the Abyss, and Jason Isbell: Running With Our Eyes Closed.

Play button link

2:04

Woodstock 99: Peace, Love, and Rage

The first film in the series, Woodstock 99: Peace, Love, and Rage, is directed by Garret Price (Love, Antosha) and tells the story of Woodstock ‘99.

Play button link

1:52

Jagged

Jagged features an in-depth interview with Alanis Morissette on her groundbreaking 1995 album Jagged Little Pill, as well as never-before-seen archival material.

Play button link

2:00

DMX: Don't Try to Understand

Focusing on a year in the life of rapper Earl “DMX” Simmons, the film bears witness to a man searching for reinvention and redemption.

Play button link

1:40

Listening to Kenny G

A humorous but incisive look at the saxophonist Kenny G., the best-selling instrumental artist of all time, and quite possibly one of the most famous musicians today.

Play button link

1:35

Mr. Saturday Night

This documentary chronicles the meteoric career of Australian entrepreneur Robert Stigwood and the 1977 cultural touchstone Saturday Night Fever.

Play button link

1:48

Juice WRLD: Into the Abyss

An intimate and often eye-opening exploration of the life and all-too-short career of wunderkind rapper Juice WRLD.
